intro: Matthiola perennis var. anremerica, commonly known as the American stock, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in late summer to early fall. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. Its compact growth habit and long flowering period make it a valuable addition to gardens.
